titles: Eyaggeloigrapha. Or, Some seasonable and modest thoughts, in order to the furtherance and promoting the affairs of religion, and the gospel, especially in Wales Mainly tending to the discovery of the evills of extreams, and the spirit of errour and dissention, that hinders the success, and the begetting of a due temper and moderation of judgement, with an universall love and peace amongst us. All, rationally, materially, and very moderately handled. By J.L. Esquire.
author: Lewis, John, Esquire.
publisher: printed for N. Ekins, and are to be sold at the Gun near the west end of Pauls,
notes: The first word in title is in Greek letters.
Reproduction of the original at the British Library.
keywords: Church of England --  Wales --  Early works to 1800.
